node.excerpt: Back in November 2019, GitHub released GitHub Actions. An "API for cause and effect" they called it.  Basically, GitHub Actions allow you to program things to happen when other things happen to your repo. For example, running tests on Pull Requests…

frontmatter.title: BigCommerce Stencil CI/CD with GitHub Actions
frontmatter.subtitle: Publish Your Theme on Every Commit to Main

node.excerpt: So, you want to make some changes to an Open Source Repo? Good for you. That's the beauty of Open Source, even just fixing typos in the documentation makes a difference. Today I'm going to walk you through keeping your copy of a repo up to date with…

frontmatter.title: I've Forked The Repo, Now What?
frontmatter.subtitle: Syncing Your Repo With the Upstream Repo
